page.title: 19TOURISM-SPETCHLEY PARK
page.content: {SPETCHLEY PARK}lies 3 miles outside Worcester on the A422. Its lovely gardens, landscaped deer park and lakeside walks are open to the public. The fine Georgian hall, by local architect John Tasker, is not open to visitors.{Parking}is available in the stableyard.The gardens contain a rose lawn, a walled melon garden and miniature gardens with many rare and exotic plants from China.Within the parkland there is a moat and an extensive lake, home for many birds. Across the deer park, containing Red and Fallow deer, are magnificent views of Malvern Hills, the Cotswolds and Bredon Hill. The{gardens}are open from April 1 to September 30, Mon-Fri 11AM - 5AM. It is closed on a Saturday, but open on a Sunday from 2PM - 5.30PM.{price}for adults-Â£1.20 For children & OAPS -60p.
